config.lang_label: Language-selector will always be labeled in English too.
config.backup_camera_folder_mask_header: Directories to be backed up on smartphones and cameras
config.backup_camera_folder_mask_label:
Instructions for the backup behavior for certain cameras or smartphones can be given here.
Entries here have the form:
"CAMERA:PATH"
The name of a connected camera can be found on the page "System" at "Camera/Smartphone".
If an instruction is to apply to all cameras, "*" (without further additions) can be used as a joker for all devices.
The path does not have to be specified in full. It is enough to use a significant part of it.
Examples:
"*:DCIM"
"*:DCIM;MyCamera:IMAGES"
"" (Field remains empty, backup all folders of all cameras.)
More information at the wiki
config.behavior_notify_label: Try to send mails about actual links to this Little Backup Box and about finished backups?
config.behavior_mail_html_label: If mails are activated, should they be formated in HTML?
config.behavior_disp_ip_label: If display is activated, print IP every minute.
config.behavior_power_off_idle_time_label: Select the idle time after which the system should be stopped.
config.view_bg_image_label: You can select an image for your background. Please store own images in
config.password_label1: The password to protect your Little-Backup-Box. Used for the web-interface, filebrowser, ssh and samba-Windows-shares. Username in all cases is lbb. For linux-user "pi" the password is set too.
config.password_remove_label: Check to remove the password-protection. Passwords for linux-users (lbb, pi) will not be removed.
config.cloud_header: rcloud GUI opens in a new window.
config.update_text:
Update Little Backup Box

Caution:

  • The update starts immediately behind the following link!
  • The update can render the system unusable.
  • The update can cause a considerable download volume and thus possibly costs.
  • The update can take several minutes or longer, depending on the Internet speed.

Only perform the update if you ...
  • could also perform a new installation if necessary
  • have a stable internet connection
  • have a stable power supply

Update now - no more steps before!
config.save_settings_download_text: Get a zip-archive with your settings
config.backup_target_basedir_cloud_header: Base folder on the cloud server (destination)
config.backup_target_basedir_cloud_label: The backup on the cloud server is carried out under this directory.
config.rsync_module_label1: Module name on the rsync server, e.g. 'little-backup-box' (default:
config.rsync_module_label2:
).
The module name is defined on the server side in rsyncd.conf and is set in [square brackets]. Also note readme_rsync.md .

tools.help_text:
Repair

Do not use unless you know what you are doing. It could damage your storage!

Procedure:

  1. Check your power supply. Power interruption may damage storage beyond repair.
  2. Make sure that no backup job is running.
  3. Do not click any buttons until all check and repair operations are completed. Do not start any processes!
  4. Run filesystem check first.
  5. If you see any errors in the log, run filesystem repair.
  6. When the repair operation is finished, power down the machine and unplug the storage devices before boot.

update.warning: Do NOT STOP or reload while running!
update.return_link: Return to Little Backup Box - DO NOT CLICK BEFORE THE UPDATE IS FINISHED!
